column5: Are there any decent maps available for Perrault or Cedar? Looks like I'll be making a trip to the area this summer for the first time in maybe 10 years and I was hoping there would be some better maps available. So far I haven't been able to find anything but the same stuff that was around 10 years ago.
Maybe try this place ...always see them at the All Canada shows..www.canadamapsales.com

Canada Map Sales is definitely the place to go. Their maps are high quality and you can get water resistant or laminated copies. I have several maps from them and they are really fun to own. Their selection has some limitations, but my guess is that the lakes you seek will be available. Good fishin' Doc Lee

Dave google Red Lake Digital Media Inc. ph 807.727.3952. You get Wabaskang/Perrault on one map, Cedar/Cliff on the other. My waterproof maps are 11 yrs old and still in excellent shape. Just what your asking for.

Thanks for the replies. Dart, does the perrault map have any of the lakes upstream on the ord river? After reading up on the internet it appears there's an area of the lakes I haven't explored in the past.

We've been up the Ord many times..a few of our "explorers" a few years back too it south out of St Clair..after a little way theres a dammed up part that is impassable...our whole group went there two years ago and fished the falls area created by the dam and it was great..not in size but in numbers..I know that on Google Earth it looks like you can keep going to the other lakes but, unless something has changed or we missed something, you cant
